content.webTitle: Catch-up TV Guide: From The Thick Of It to Arnold's Blueprint

fields.headline: Catch-up TV Guide: From The Thick Of It to Arnold's Blueprint
fields.bodyText: TV: The Thick Of It The Thick Of It is having a mid-series break this week, which presents a catch-up opportunity for those who, stung by the BBC's bizarre Saturday-night scheduling, missed out on the "coalicious" opening salvo of episodes. It's all change for Peter Mannion, who is now minister of DoSAC, but thanks to the terms of the power-sharing agreement, has a grating junior minister to contend with. Malcolm – locked out of the corridors of power for the first time in the series – is nevertheless busy, masterminding a plot against opposition leader Nicola Murray: she's going to "kick her own head in". BBC iPlayer TV: The Audience So, 50 strangers follow someone around for a week and make a life-altering decision for them? Gimmicky nonsense, yeah? In fact, The Audience surprised everyone by making for compelling, even moving TV. Find out why on 4oD. 4oD Podcast: Radiolab It's pleasing enough to receive a first new episode (The Fact Of The Matter) in nearly four months from the entertaining, enlightening Radiolab; more exciting still is the presence of documentarian Errol Morris, who reveals a curious obsession with a photograph entitled The Valley Of The Shadow Of Death, which is regarded by some as the earliest example of war photography, and by others as a notorious piece of photo fakery. radiolab.org Web series: Camerabag.tv A tidy web-based series which focuses on photographers, their kit and how they made it to the top. Most are engaging characters with great stories and the ability to talk about Yashica T4s and still make it interesting. Alexander Wang's buddy Dan Martensen and skateboarding snapper Patrick O'Dell (of Epicly Later'd fame) are among the highlights here. camerabag.tv TV: Edge Of Darkness Though its central nuclear panic theme has long since faded from public preoccupation, this gripping drama – considered by some the finest of the 80s – continues to merit revisiting. Bob Peck's Yorkshire policeman seeks the truth behind his daughter's death and is soon caught up in the grimy world of governmental and corporate cover-up. The series is available to buy in full over on Blinkbox and iTunes. Blinkbox, iTunes TV: Arnold's Blueprint ESPN's excellent documentary series 30 For 30 begins a new run in the US later this year, with no news as yet of a UK air date. In the interim, sister site Grantland is running a companion series of shorts, beginning with a look at Arnold Schwarzenegger and his first steps towards superstardom in postwar Austria. Grantland.com
